page.title: 03LOWER HEATH SCHOOL-HISTORY
page.content: The school at Lower Heath was built in 1799 by{Sir Richard Hill}with money left by Dame Mary Hill,his stepmother, in her will.The school was called {Industry Hall}and was built to give the children who lived on the{Hill family estates{'useful employment,}to rid them of idleness and to train them to be{good and useful servants.' (Extract from pamphlet dated 1804). The original building cost Â£230 to erect.The schoolroom measured 27.5ft by 16ft.and the kitchen 16ft square. There were also rooms where one of the schoolmistresses,Mary Bradshaw,lived with her parents. She was paid Â£16 a year.The 40 children were taught to {card wool, spin it and knit it up.}The other schoolmistress,Hannah Blantern, was paid Â£12 a year.Instruction was also given in{reading}and the {catechism.
